name: Hilton Anaheim

reviews.text: Woke up this morning to no hot water. Tried calling guest services several times from 8am to 9am but we couldn't get anyone to answer. We honestly called 6 or 7 times. We finally gave up and took a freezing cold shower. Not the best way to start your morning. I understand that these things happen, but we were calling to make sure it wasn't just our unit and to see if they had any info on when it may be fixed. We found out later by speaking to another guest that the hot water was out for the entire hotel.
reviews.title: No hot water and paper thin walls

reviews.text: The walls were also very thin. We were woken up by our neighbors at 12:30am and then again at 5am. I've stayed at many hotels for business and vacation and this was by far the worst. It was almost like we were sharing the same room.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The positives were the beds were comfortable and the room and hotel were clean and modern.
reviews.title: Good hotel
Staff are Wonderful!
reviews.text: Stayed in the executive suite for a conference. Very good location. Few good restaurants nearby. They charge more for parking if you are a guest which does not make sense to me. Good thing that wifi was complimentary. The hotel is in a good condition but the bathroom was not very clean.
I was disturbed to see hair all over the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We checked in to the Hilton Anaheim on September 29 and stayed until October 6, 2012. I booked the hotel through selloffvacations.com in May for approximately 60% less than the rate on expedia.ca. The hotel is just down the street from Disneyland and it would be walking distance with older children. We opted for the ART Shuttle as we were travelling with a 4 year old and no stroller. Check-in was quick. My mom used her Hilton Honors card and we were able to get free wifi in our room. Parking was also discounted to $5/day. The room was nice and clean. Nothing special, 2 beds, 1 desk, nightstand, flat screen TV, and 2 Queen beds. We were on the 14th Floor facing the courtyard (south). The beds were very comfortable and I loved the pillows. We were able to use the pool 2 times. The maid always left fresh towels and the room was pristine. The room did not come with a fridge but we called down to the front desk and they had one brought up. We also called down for a bottle opener and we had one within 10 minutes. I only have one complaint...the hallway noise was very disruptive during the night (not every night). The service elevators were very close to our room and we could hear carts rolling over tile at all different hours (this is the reason for my average sleep rating). The hotel has a very business feel to it but I expected that considering it proximity to the Convention Center. When I was researching hotels I looked at some of the hotels that seemed a bit more resort like but their management responses to some of the trip advisor critiques were in my opinion unprofessional. A final word on the Hilton Anaheim...I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Disney Vacation: 1 mom, 1 grandma, 1 kid

reviews.text: My staff and I were out here for a fun filled work event in Anaheim. Jennifer Sacks (Marketing Manager) was such a huge help getting my staff and I rooms. The hotel staff was just as generous and professional. The rooms were beautiful and as funny as it may sound, the soap smelled absolutely lovely :-) The hotel was walking distance to everything, which was great, because traffic wasn't the best in that area. This is definitely a place I would recommend and visit again.
reviews.title: Definitely a place to revisit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. The front desk gave us a room with a Disney view, which is normally an extra charge. Our room was beautiful, a corner room on the 10th floor, and we could watch the fireworks in Disneyland from the comfort of our room. We didn't think the walk to our room was too far, which was a comment I see many people have made in their reviews. We preferred walking a bit further if it meant a larger corner room with wall to ceiling windows, and quiet.
reviews.title: The highlight of our trip

reviews.text: There is some construction being done on the front of the hotel, but none of the rooms are affected. So the construction was nothing to worry about. Yes, the parking was $16 a night, and the garage can get crowded with convention goers. We chose to walk to Disney land instead of taking the shuttle, and it was a nice walk - about 10 minutes.
reviews.title: The Reservation Desk Is Terrible

reviews.text: About 5 minutes away in the other direction is a 7-Eleven and convenience store that sells liquor, so we were able to pick up a few essentials easily. We loved our room, it was probably the best hotel room we ever had. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Convention hotel

reviews.text: Stayed there for a convention - has good location, standard hilton rooms which are ok, so plus for that but I did not feel good here. Stood an hour in line to get booked in because there were only three agents doing it despite the fact they knew there will be a convention.In the morning same thing- an hour plus in starbucks line- there should be another coffee place in hotel is obvious. Possibly they could get a little more organized and prepared for large amount of guests since it is near a convention center and huge groups arrive often.Other than that the pool is really cool - it is open late and one can watch a movie while in the water!
reviews.title: did not like it

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights to visit Disneyland. The lobby looks nice as well as the carpets in the hallway looks clean and new. However, the carpet in the room is dirty and stained. You could see the stains even when it's colored dark. The towels are very old and it's dirty white. The service and food at the restaurant Mix was mediocre. It is better to eat in Disney Downtown where there are good restaurants. Even the restaurants at CA Disney Adventure are much better. The beddings are good and bed comfortable. They Disney shuttle service doesn't come to this hotel. For the price that I paid $135/night, it's acceptable, but wouldn't mind paying more for a better hotel with better service. Would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Needs Improvement

reviews.text: Same review as others who don't care for this specific Hilton hotel. We only had freezng cold water on Saturday September 29, 2012 to shower in. When we called the front desk we got hung up on 5 times! Housekeeping never picked up their phone. Called Hilton's 800 number and the reservation staff at Hilton got hung up on and then when they tried again they never answered. The parking structure is horrible, we paid extra for a Dinsey view room and what a waste of money that was. The room was smelled musty as if it had been wet for days. Hilton Corporate needs to do something about this hotel, its management and the staff. Horrible experience and never again will we stay here at this location. Compensation for all the rudeness was not enough. I have had better experiences with overall stay and staff with lower level Hilton Hotel chains. There are better places to stay near Disneyland that are only another 100 plus yards away from this location.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience

reviews.text: As another guest wrote, we wer there on September 29th and we too woke up to no hot water and like them, endured a cold shower. I tried to call the desk to see what and when the service might be restored but could not get past the answering machine that kept telling me how great Hilton Hotels are. When I went downstairs to see what was happening, I was told by a woman by the desk they were sorry and had no idea when the system would be restored. Couple this with the entire area around the Hotel being torn up makes just getting to the entrance a challenge, and this was not a great experience. I know bad things happen in all hotels, but to me, what makes a good hotel stand apart is how they respond to adversity. In my opinion, this hotel did a lousy job and treated their guests like they had no right to know what was going on even though rooms are priced in the over $100 per night range, they could not be bothered. The following morning, my bill was slipped under the door with no reduction in the rate to compensate for the lousy service. I did go the front desk and raised the issue with the clerk who did reduce the rate but only after I had to get irritated and make a trip down to the desk did they offer that reduction. Again, a good hotel would have made that credit across the board to all the guests affected without having to make each guest angry and confront the front desk staff. I would have expected more of a hotel that is part of the Hilton chain.
reviews.title: Hilton should be ashamed

reviews.text: Be ready to pay for parking and after taxes, your bill will be half again as much as you probably expect to pay. Disneyland is a long walk but is doable but be prepared to run the gauntlet of bums the city of Anaheim allows that are panhandling all along the way. I’m glad my kids were not with me for this stroll. I hope this hotel is not an indication of what Hilton Hotels are becoming.
reviews.title: You cannot in reality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for my birthday last weekend. The staff was very nice. It is convienient to Disneyland. The parking is not so great the spaces are narrow unless you have a small car. We didn't have any hot water Saturday Morning, but the problem was fixed by the time we got back to our room in the evening. Although, the message on our voice mail was time stamped at 10:15 A.M. not terribly prompt. The water problem affected the whole hotel. Don't waste your money on the Disney View with a lanai. We had a view of the back of cars land. If I had chosen the less expensive Disney View I probably would have been on a higher floor and had a better view. I don't think I would stay here again. There are better options in the area.
reviews.title: There are better options

reviews.text: If you book a Disney view, you will get a great night view of the fireworks. Parking not so good since your paying an extra 16-20 bucks a night. Lastly, if you walk to Disneyland from the Hotel, it would take you approx 10...so not too bad.
reviews.title: Ask for Disneyland View.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in king standard room . That bed was horrible because the room itself was slanted at a downward angle. So basically slept upside down. I made management aware of a problem they probably weren't aware of , and they changed our room assignment .. The new room had a view of Disneyland and was great !!! Room service is a bit pricey. Spent $45 on one standard breakfast. But I would definitely stay here again. The ART bus is very easy to catch to the parks. Only spent about $120 after taxes a night. Definitely a better value than son of the others.
reviews.title: Great customer service and rooms worth the value !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: since 2009 we are back at the Anaheim Hilton when we are staying in the area. The years before we had several bad experiences. Now we feel better year by year. Very polite and professional check in and also thanks to the lovely waitresses at the restaurant. See you again in December
reviews.title: back at the Anaheim Hilton

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and found the rooms clean b;ut the food situation was a joke. If you did not want to sit down in the restaurant you had the choice of the food court. Only trouble is that Starbucks is closed by 6pm. We went to eat at 6.30 and found that only 2 places were opened. I think that this is unacceptable. They seemed to only cater for the business people visiting the convention centre when in truth there were quited a lot of families staying there. Also the renovations out the front were inconvenient but bearable.
reviews.title: food court a joke

description: Enjoy a satisfying California experience at the Hilton Anaheim hotel, located in the heart of Orange County, adjacent to the Anaheim Convention Center and across the street from the Disneyland® Resort. Reach the hotel easily with convenient access from all major freeways and Southern California airports.This upscale hotel offers Mix Restaurant & Lounge, a Starbucks, a recently renovated outdoor pool with two whirlpool tubs and the new addition of the Kids Splash Zone! The Health Club at Hilton Anaheim (daily fee applies) offers all the amenities of a private health club, including spa treatments, Precor equipment and a tranquil indoor pool.Enjoy Disneyland® Resort benefits at this Anaheim family hotel by paying a visit to the Disney® Desk where expert cast members will offer advice and queue-jump tickets to the world-class attraction right across the street. Experience the magic of Disneyland® Resort from a special Disney® View room, providing great views of the fireworks display and the resort. All guest rooms and suites feature modern comforting amenities and contemporary styling.
